channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These 2 kinds of employees are emerging in the AI-generated ‘workslop’ era—here’s why it may be better to write the email yourself
item.description: Forget “this could've been an email.” As AI automates more work, the new catchphrase at the office may be “this could've been written yourself.”

item.title: Why Entrepreneurs Earn More Than Salaried Employees
item.description: A recent study by the Minneapolis Fed found small business owners see faster rates of income growth than people collecting a paycheck.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs may be bringing in a lot of revenue but they’ve also been a ‘tax on capital, so far,’ top economist says
item.description: The "mystery" of the 2025 economy is vastly different from the record profit margins of 2021 and 2022, Morgan Stanley's Michael Gapen says.

item.title: Before the McLaren CEO got a $50 million payday from his team’s F1 championship, he was a high-school dropout who got his start on Wheel of Fortune
item.description: Zak Brown’s McLaren Racing Formula 1 team won its second consecutive Constructors’ Championship on Sunday.

item.title: Remote Employees Remain Highly Productive, a New Survey Says
item.description: While many employers now insist on people coming in, people working outside the office continue to perform well.

item.title: AMD stock jumps on OpenAI deal as Big Tech seeks to reduce reliance on Nvidia

item.title: 6 In-Demand Skills That Lead to Higher Salaries
item.description: You may have to consider bumping up your pay scale to attract candidates with these sought-after skills.

item.title: Instagram launches its own version of the Golden Globes
item.description: For actors, it’s the Golden Globes. Musicians, it’s the Grammys. Now, content creators have their own award to aspire to. Introducing Instagram Rings....

item.title: An NFL Coach Went Off on His Player After a Big Mistake. It’s a Major Lesson in Leadership
item.description: Running back Emari Demercado made a huge blunder that may have cost the Arizona Cardinals yesterday’s game. But his coach’s reaction could cost the te...

item.title: AMD stock soars as OpenAI bets big on its chips
item.description: The AI arms race turned a new page on Monday, as OpenAI and chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) announced that the two have agreed to a new partner...

item.title: How the 2026 World Cup is being shaped by Trump’s friendship with FIFA chief Infantino
item.description: The plan started coming together inside a luxury box at MetLife Stadium. As the Premier League’s Chelsea was on its way to a shutout victory at the Cl...

item.title: OPEC+ to increase oil production in November
item.description: A group of countries that are part of the OPEC+ alliance of oil-exporting countries has agreed to a small boost in oil production, citing a steady glo...

item.title: How tech rebels challenged Apple’s dominance in the app economy
item.description: Below, Tim Higgins shares five key insights from his new book, iWar: Fortnite, Elon Musk, Spotify, WeChat, and Laying Siege to Apple’s Empire . Tim is...

item.title: Jeff Bezos tells Gen Z entrepreneurs to gain work experience before launching new companies: ‘I started Amazon when I was 30’
item.description: The Amazon founder reminds Gen Z that Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates are the "exception."

item.title: How Economic Uncertainty Is Sapping Executives’ Confidence

item.title: Economic calendar: Fed speeches in focus as shutdown keeps most new data at bay
Are S&P 500 index funds riskier today than at the height of the dot-com bubble?
Is Tesla unveiling a cheaper Model Y soon? Here’s what to know about it.
